task.title: How to Avoid Common Mistakes Maintaining Cast Iron Cookware
task.shortdesc: Understanding and avoiding common mistakes can help you prolong the life and performance of your cast iron pan.

ul.li: Avoid using metal utensils that can scratch the seasoned surface of the pan. opt for wooden or silicone utensils instead.
Refrain from cooking highly acidic foods, such as tomato sauce or citrus-based dishes for prolonged periods in your cast iron pan, as this can degrade the seasoning.

Store your cast iron pan in a dry location to prevent rusting, and consider placing a paper towel or cloth between stacked pans to protect their surfaces.
To learn more about preventing common mistakes and maintaining the quality of your cast iron pan, consult reputable culinary sources like Cook's Illustrated or the Cook's Country magazine.
